doctorRecommendations.reason: Elevated cholesterol levels and cardiac risk factors

specialists.name: Lisa Hernandez, RD
specialists.address: 321 Healthy Living St, San Francisco, CA

dietaryRecommendations.title: Heart-Healthy Diet Plan
dietaryRecommendations.description: A nutrition plan to help lower cholesterol and improve cardiovascular health.

foodsToIncrease.name: Oatmeal and high-fiber foods
foodsToIncrease.benefits: Soluble fiber helps reduce LDL cholesterol
foodsToIncrease.servingSuggestion: Start your day with a bowl of steel-cut oats topped with berries

foodsToIncrease.name: Fatty fish (salmon, mackerel, sardines)
foodsToIncrease.benefits: Rich in omega-3 fatty acids that can lower triglycerides and reduce inflammation
foodsToIncrease.servingSuggestion: 3-4oz serving, grilled or baked with herbs

foodsToIncrease.name: Nuts and seeds
foodsToIncrease.benefits: Contain heart-healthy fats, fiber, and plant sterols that can help lower cholesterol
foodsToIncrease.servingSuggestion: Small handful (about 1.5oz) as a snack or added to meals

foodsToIncrease.name: Beans and legumes
foodsToIncrease.benefits: High in fiber and protein, low in fat, and can help lower cholesterol
foodsToIncrease.servingSuggestion: 1/2 cup serving added to salads, soups, or as a side dish

foodsToIncrease.name: Fruits and vegetables
foodsToIncrease.benefits: Rich in antioxidants, fiber, and nutrients that support heart health
foodsToIncrease.servingSuggestion: Fill half your plate with colorful vegetables and fruits

foodsToAvoid.name: Red meat and processed meats
foodsToAvoid.impact: High in saturated fat which can raise cholesterol levels
foodsToAvoid.alternatives: Lean poultry, fish, or plant-based proteins like tofu and tempeh

foodsToAvoid.name: Full-fat dairy products
foodsToAvoid.impact: Contain saturated fats that can raise LDL cholesterol
foodsToAvoid.alternatives: Low-fat or plant-based milk, yogurt, and cheese options

foodsToAvoid.name: Fried foods
foodsToAvoid.impact: Often high in trans fats and calories, can raise cholesterol and contribute to weight gain
foodsToAvoid.alternatives: Baked, grilled, or air-fried versions of your favorite foods

foodsToAvoid.name: Baked goods and sweets
foodsToAvoid.impact: Often contain trans fats, refined flour, and added sugars
foodsToAvoid.alternatives: Fresh fruit, dark chocolate in moderation, or homemade treats with healthier ingredients

sampleMealPlan.breakfast: Steel-cut oatmeal topped with berries, walnuts, and a sprinkle of cinnamon
sampleMealPlan.lunch: Mediterranean salad with chickpeas, vegetables, olive oil, and lemon dressing
sampleMealPlan.dinner: Baked salmon with roasted vegetables and quinoa

dietaryRecommendations.title: Blood Sugar Balancing Diet
dietaryRecommendations.description: A nutrition plan to help stabilize blood glucose levels and prevent prediabetes progression.
keyPrinciples: Focus on balanced meals with protein, healthy fats, and complex carbohydrates

foodsToIncrease.name: Non-starchy vegetables
foodsToIncrease.benefits: High in fiber and nutrients, low in carbohydrates that affect blood sugar
foodsToIncrease.servingSuggestion: Fill half your plate with colorful vegetables like leafy greens, broccoli, peppers

foodsToIncrease.name: Lean proteins
foodsToIncrease.benefits: Helps stabilize blood sugar levels and provides sustained energy
foodsToIncrease.servingSuggestion: Palm-sized portion (about 4-6oz) of chicken, fish, tofu, or legumes

foodsToIncrease.name: Healthy fats
foodsToIncrease.benefits: Slows digestion and helps prevent blood sugar spikes
foodsToIncrease.servingSuggestion: 1-2 tablespoons of olive oil, avocado, or nuts/seeds

foodsToIncrease.name: Whole grains
foodsToIncrease.benefits: Provide fiber and nutrients without the blood sugar spike of refined grains
foodsToIncrease.servingSuggestion: 1/3-1/2 cup cooked quinoa, brown rice, or oats

foodsToAvoid.name: Sugary beverages
foodsToAvoid.impact: Causes rapid blood sugar spikes with no nutritional benefit
foodsToAvoid.alternatives: Water, unsweetened tea, or water infused with fruit/herbs

foodsToAvoid.name: Refined carbohydrates
foodsToAvoid.impact: Quickly convert to sugar in the bloodstream
foodsToAvoid.alternatives: Whole grains like brown rice, quinoa, and whole wheat products in moderation

foodsToAvoid.name: Processed snack foods
foodsToAvoid.impact: Often high in refined carbs, unhealthy fats, and sodium
foodsToAvoid.alternatives: Nuts, seeds, vegetable sticks with hummus, or a piece of fruit with nut butter

foodsToAvoid.name: Large fruit servings
foodsToAvoid.impact: Can contain significant natural sugars that affect blood glucose
foodsToAvoid.alternatives: Smaller portions of lower-glycemic fruits like berries, paired with protein or fat

sampleMealPlan.breakfast: Vegetable omelette with avocado and a small serving of berries
sampleMealPlan.lunch: Grilled chicken salad with olive oil dressing and a small serving of quinoa
sampleMealPlan.dinner: Baked fish with roasted non-starchy vegetables and a side salad

groceryRecommendations.title: Heart-Healthy Grocery List
groceryRecommendations.description: A shopping guide focused on foods that can help improve cholesterol levels and cardiovascular health.

items.name: Leafy greens (spinach, kale, arugula)
items.benefits: Rich in antioxidants and nutrients that support heart health
items.tips: Look for dark, vibrant colors which indicate higher nutrient content

items.name: Berries (blueberries, strawberries, raspberries)
items.benefits: High in antioxidants and fiber that can help lower cholesterol
items.tips: Choose organic when possible or rinse thoroughly

items.name: Avocados
items.benefits: Contains heart-healthy monounsaturated fats
items.tips: Select firm avocados for later use, or softer ones for immediate consumption

items.name: Citrus fruits (oranges, grapefruit)
items.benefits: Rich in pectin fiber which can help lower cholesterol
items.tips: Choose fruits that feel heavy for their size, indicating juiciness

items.name: Cruciferous vegetables (broccoli, cauliflower, Brussels sprouts)
items.benefits: Contain compounds that may help reduce inflammation
items.tips: Look for compact, firm heads with vibrant colors

items.name: Steel-cut or rolled oats
items.benefits: Rich in soluble fiber that can help lower LDL cholesterol
items.tips: Choose less processed varieties for more fiber and nutrients

items.name: Brown rice
items.benefits: Whole grain with fiber and nutrients that white rice lacks
items.tips: Store in airtight containers to maintain freshness

items.name: Quinoa
items.benefits: Complete protein with fiber and heart-healthy nutrients
items.tips: Rinse before cooking to remove bitter coating

items.name: Whole grain bread
items.benefits: More fiber and nutrients than refined white bread
items.tips: Check ingredient list to ensure whole grains are listed first

items.name: Fatty fish (salmon, mackerel, sardines)
items.benefits: Rich in omega-3 fatty acids that support heart health
items.tips: Choose wild-caught when possible for higher omega-3 content

items.name: Beans and lentils
items.benefits: Excellent source of fiber and plant-based protein
items.tips: Canned varieties are convenient; look for low-sodium options and rinse before using

items.name: Skinless poultry
items.benefits: Lean protein source lower in saturated fat than red meat
items.tips: Choose organic or antibiotic-free when possible

items.name: Tofu and tempeh
items.benefits: Plant proteins that may help lower cholesterol
items.tips: Extra firm tofu works best for stir-fries, while softer varieties are good for smoothies

items.name: Walnuts
items.benefits: One of the best nut sources of omega-3 fatty acids
items.tips: Store in the refrigerator to prevent rancidity

items.name: Almonds
items.benefits: Contain heart-healthy monounsaturated fats and vitamin E
items.tips: Buy raw or dry roasted without added oils or salt

items.name: Flaxseeds
items.benefits: Excellent source of omega-3 fatty acids and fiber
items.tips: Grind before eating to improve nutrient absorption

items.name: Chia seeds
items.benefits: Rich in omega-3s, fiber, and antioxidants
items.tips: Add to smoothies, yogurt, or make chia pudding

items.name: Extra virgin olive oil
items.benefits: Rich in monounsaturated fats and antioxidants
items.tips: Use for low to medium-heat cooking and salad dressings

items.name: Avocado oil
items.benefits: High smoke point and heart-healthy monounsaturated fats
items.tips: Good for higher-heat cooking methods

items.name: Low-fat Greek yogurt
items.benefits: High in protein and probiotics with less fat than regular yogurt
items.tips: Choose plain varieties and add your own fruit to avoid added sugars

items.name: Unsweetened almond or oat milk
items.benefits: Lower in calories and saturated fat than whole milk
items.tips: Check for added calcium and vitamin D to ensure nutrient adequacy

mealDeliveryServices.name: Green Chef
mealDeliveryServices.specialty: Organic ingredients with heart-healthy meal options

mealDeliveryServices.name: Sunbasket
mealDeliveryServices.specialty: Organic produce and clean ingredients with Mediterranean diet options

groceryRecommendations.title: Blood Sugar Friendly Grocery List
groceryRecommendations.description: A shopping guide focused on foods that help maintain stable blood glucose levels.

items.name: Non-starchy vegetables (broccoli, bell peppers, zucchini)
items.benefits: Low in carbohydrates and high in fiber and nutrients
items.tips: Aim for at least 3 different colors to ensure nutrient variety

items.name: Leafy greens (spinach, kale, arugula)
items.benefits: Minimal impact on blood sugar with maximum nutrient density
items.tips: Pre-wash and store with paper towels to extend freshness

items.name: Low-glycemic fruits (berries, apples, pears)
items.benefits: Less impact on blood sugar than tropical fruits
items.tips: Pair with a protein source to minimize blood sugar impact

items.name: Avocados
items.benefits: Healthy fats that don't impact blood sugar and promote satiety
items.tips: Refrigerate ripe avocados to extend shelf life

items.name: Eggs
items.benefits: Complete protein with minimal impact on blood sugar
items.tips: Hard boil a batch for quick, protein-rich snacks

items.name: Chicken and turkey
items.benefits: Lean proteins that help stabilize blood sugar
items.tips: Buy in bulk and freeze portions for convenience

items.name: Wild-caught fish
items.benefits: Protein with healthy omega-3 fats
items.tips: Frozen fish fillets are convenient and often more affordable

items.name: Tofu and tempeh
items.benefits: Plant proteins with minimal impact on blood sugar
items.tips: Firm tofu works well in stir-fries; tempeh has a nuttier flavor

items.name: Nuts and seeds (almonds, walnuts, chia, flax)
items.benefits: Healthy fats and protein that help slow digestion and prevent blood sugar spikes
items.tips: Portion into small containers for easy grab-and-go snacks

items.name: Olive oil and avocado oil
items.benefits: Healthy fats that don't impact blood sugar
items.tips: Use olive oil for low-heat cooking and avocado oil for higher-heat methods

items.name: Olives
items.benefits: Healthy fats and antioxidants with minimal carbs
items.tips: Look for varieties without added sugars

items.name: Plain Greek yogurt
items.benefits: High protein content helps balance blood sugar impact
items.tips: Choose full-fat or 2% varieties which are more satiating

items.name: Unsweetened almond milk
items.benefits: Very low in carbs compared to regular milk
items.tips: Check labels to ensure no added sugars

items.name: Cheese
items.benefits: Protein and fat with minimal impact on blood sugar
items.tips: Aged cheeses like cheddar and parmesan have less lactose

items.name: Apple cider vinegar
items.benefits: May help improve insulin sensitivity when consumed before meals
items.tips: Mix 1-2 tablespoons with water before meals

items.name: Canned beans
items.benefits: Fiber and protein to help slow carbohydrate absorption
items.tips: Rinse thoroughly to reduce sodium content

items.name: Whole grains (quinoa, brown rice)
items.benefits: More fiber and nutrients than refined grains, with less impact on blood sugar
items.tips: Cook in batches and refrigerate or freeze portions

mealDeliveryServices.name: Factor
mealDeliveryServices.specialty: Fresh, fully prepared meals with low-carb options
